intro: Candollea barleei, commonly known as the barlee plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in compound umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Candollea barleei is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory ailments.
